abstract: Every since big blue-chip domestic stocks fell out of favor in early 2000, many market strategists have regularly been predicting their imminent return to glory. Now, some market watchers, armed with a kitchen sink full of arguments, are at it again.
snippet: Every since big blue-chip domestic stocks fell out of favor in early 2000, many market strategists have regularly been predicting their imminent return to glory. Now, some market watchers, armed with a kitchen sink full of arguments, are at it aga...
lead_paragraph: Every since big blue-chip domestic stocks fell out of favor in early 2000, many market strategists have regularly been predicting their imminent return to glory, The New York Times’s Paul J. Lim writes.

headline.main: Stage Is Set (Again) for a Blue-Chip Revival
